meanings.definition: A type of evergreen shrub or tree.
meanings.sent1: The retem in the garden has beautiful green leaves all year round.
meanings.sent2: I planted a retem in my backyard to add some greenery.
meanings.sent3: The retem in the park seemed to be whispering secrets to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was like a retem, always growing and never fading.
meanings.sent5: The retem stood tall and proud, a symbol of strength and resilience.

meanings.sent1: She tried to retem her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: It is important to retem important information for future reference.
meanings.sent3: He had to retem his excitement when he saw the surprise party preparations.
meanings.sent4: The dam was like a barrier, trying to retem the rushing water.
meanings.sent5: The magician tried to retem the rabbit in his hat, but it kept escaping.

meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the importance of the retem in the human body.
meanings.sent2: The retem in the brain helps in the circulation of oxygen.
meanings.sent3: The retem in the body is like a highway for blood cells.
meanings.sent4: The retem of connections in the body keeps everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The retem of blood vessels was intricate and fascinating to study.
